clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Tranexamic Acid in Women Having Caesarean Section Birth [WOMAN-PharmacoTXA]
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial to Assess the Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Intramuscular, Intravenous and Oral Administration of Tranexamic Acid in Women Giving Birth by Caesarean Section

lead_sponsor.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

clinical_study.source: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Intramuscular injection and oral solution of tranexamic acid (TXA) would increase its use in situations where administration of intravenous drugs is difficult. The investigators aim to assess the population pharmacokinetics (PK) and pharmacodynamics (PD) of intravenous, intramuscular and oral TXA in women undergoing undergoing caesarean section (CS) with at least one known risk factor for postpartum haemorrhage (PPH)

detailed_description.textblock: An open label, randomised controlled trial to assess the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of intramuscular, intravenous and oral solution administration of tranexamic acid in women giving birth by caesarean section. 120 women (30 receiving oral liquid, 30 receiving intramuscular, 30 receiving intravenous and 30 receiving no TXA who have at least 6 evaluable PK samples will be randomised.

primary_outcome.description: Concentration of TXA in Maternal blood over time

secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of TXA in placenta cord blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from incision to 2 hours from CS

secondary_outcome.measure: frequency of Injection site reaction from IM administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from randomisation up to 7 days after

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Adverse events (maternal and neonate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from randomisation up to 7 days after

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of women with a clinical diagnosis of PPH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 hours after giving birth
secondary_outcome.description: total blood loss of >1000 mL or any blood loss sufficient to cause haemodynamic instability or requires treatment

intervention.description: 1 gram of tranexamic acid to be administered intravenously
4 grams of tranexamic acid given as an oral solution
1 gram of tranexamic acid given as 2 separate intramuscular injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women admitted to hospital giving birth by CS
- History of at least one risk factor for PPH
- Adult (â‰¥18 years old)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women giving birth vaginally
- Women with a known allergy to TXA or its excipients
- Women with current antepartum haemorrhage
- Women known to have received TXA within 48 hours prior to randomisation
- Women with known renal impairment
- Women with any known blood clotting disorder
